snippet: Carmelo Anthony shot 7 for 23 from the field as the Knicks, who set an N.B.A. record by losing their 13th straight playoff game, fell to 0-3 in their series against the Heat.
abstract: Miami Heat defeat New York Knicks, 87-70, to take 3-0 lead in first-round NBA playoff series and push the Knicks to the brink of elimination. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: The bodies kept falling away, his support system stripped, until Carmelo Anthony stood as the Knicks' last bulwark between postseason relevance and extinction. So he kept dribbling and shooting and powering through traffic, until he had run out of room and run out of time. By late Thursday evening, the Knicks had just about run out of chances, as well, after an 87-70 rout by the Miami Heat that muted Madison Square Garden and pushed them to the brink of elimination. The Heat lead the first-round series by three games to none, a margin no N.B.A. team has overcome.

headline.main: Knicks Are Off and Almost Out
headline.kicker: PLAYOFFS: CONFERENCE QUARTERFINALS | GAME 3: HEAT 87, KNICKS 70
